messageBody:
Not sure if this is the proper platform to ask questions about ant's JUnit
task, but in lack of a better one, here goes:

What I want to do is cause the build to fail if any JUnit tests fail.
However, even if one test fails, I want to continue running all the other
tests, so that one test does not hide an error from another one. My problem
is that I cannot get JUnit both to cause a failure of the build AND run all
test. It's always just one or the other. The junit task is defined like
this:

<junit fork="yes" haltonfailure="on" printsummary="on">
<batchtest fork="yes" haltonfailure="on" todir="./tests">
<fileset dir="${class.java.test.dir}">
<include name="**/*Test*.class" />
<exclude name="**/AllTests.class" />
</fileset>
</batchtest>
<formatter type="plain" />
<classpath refid="test.classpath"/>
</junit>

1 - Why are there two haltonfailure attributes?

2 - Is it possible to set them (or any others) so that I get the desired
behaviour?
